The Levites
When*p David was old and full of years, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
He*p also gathered together all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.
The Levites thirty years old or more were counted, and the total number of men was thirty-eight thousand.
David said, “Of these, twenty-four thousand are to be in charge of the work of the temple of the Lord*s and six thousand are to be officials and judges.
Four thousand are to be gatekeepers and four thousand are to praise the Lord*s with the musical instruments I have provided for that purpose.”
David*p separated the Levites into divisions corresponding to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

The*p sons of Merari: Mahli*ld and Mushi. The*ln sons of Mahli: Eleazar*ld and Kish.

These*p were the descendants of Levi by their families—the heads of families as they were registered under their names and counted individually, that is, the workers twenty years old or more who served in the temple of the Lord.*s
For David had said, “Since the Lord,*s the God of Israel, has granted rest to his people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever,
the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles used in its service.”
According to the last instructions of David, the Levites were counted from those twenty years old or more.

The*p duty of the Levites was to help Aaron’s descendants in the service of the temple of the Lord:*s to be in charge of the courtyards, the side rooms, the purification of all sacred things and the performance of other duties at the house of God.

They were in charge of the bread set out on the table, the special flour for the grain offerings, the thin loaves made without yeast, the baking and the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.
They were also to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord.*s They were to do the same in the evening

and whenever burnt offerings were presented to the Lord*s on the Sabbaths, at the New Moon feasts and at the appointed festivals. They were to serve before the Lord*s regularly in the proper number and in the way prescribed for them.
And*p so the Levites carried out their responsibilities for the tent of meeting, for the Holy Place and, under their relatives the descendants of Aaron, for the service of the temple of the Lord.*s
